greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array T read by rows: T(n,0) = T(n,n) = 1 for all n >= 0, T(n,k) = T(n-1,k-1) + T(n-1,k) for odd n and 1< = k <= n-1, T(n,k) = T(n-1,k-1) + T(n-1,k) + T(n-2,k-1) for even n and 1 <= k <= n-1.
comment: T(n,k) is number of lattice paths from (0,0) to (n,n-2k) using steps U=(1,1), D=(1,-1) and, at levels ...,-4,-2,0,2,4,..., also H=(2,0). Example: T(4,1)=6 because we have the following paths from (0,0) to (4,2): UUUD, UUH, UUDU, UDUU, HUU and DUUU. Row sums yield A026383. Column 1 is A032766, column 2 is A026381, column 3 is A026382. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 25 2004
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..125 of triangle, flattened
Paul Barry, Jacobsthal Decompositions of Pascal's Triangle, Ternary Trees, and Alternating Sign Matrices, Journal of Integer Sequences, 19, 2016, #16.3.5.
formula: T(n, k) = number of integer strings s(0), ..., s(n) such that s(0)=0, s(n) = n-2k, where, for 1 <= i <= n, s(i) is even if i is even and |s(i) - s(i-1)| <= 1.
Generating polynomial for row 2n is (1 + 3*t + t^2)^n;
Generating polynomial for row 2n+1 it is (1+t)*(1 + 3*t + t^2)^n. (End)
mathematica: Flatten[a] (* _Roger L. Bagula_ and _Gary W. Adamson_, Dec 04 2009 *)
program: a026374_tabl = [1] : map fst (map snd $ iterate f (1, ([1, 1], [1]))) where
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
